William & Mary.title: Modern Physics
William & Mary.description: 20th-century physics: introduction to relativity, quantum, and wave-particle duality theories.

William & Mary.title: Experimental Atomic Lab
William & Mary.description: Experiments in atomic spectroscopy, interferometry, and blackbody radiation.

William & Mary.title: Electronics Lab
William & Mary.description: Circuit theory, design, simulation, debugging, and application using passive and active components.

William & Mary.title: Mathematical Physics
William & Mary.description: Complex analysis, series solutions of differential equations, and partial differential equations.

William & Mary.title: Classical Mechanics I
William & Mary.description: The simple harmonic oscillator, coupled oscillations and normal modes, variational methods, Lagrangian and Hamiltonian mechanics, central forces.

William & Mary.title: Classical Mechanics II
William & Mary.description: Scattering, rigid body rotation, inertia tensor, noninertial frames, continuum mechanics, special relativity, nonlinear dynamics and chaos.

William & Mary.title: Experimental Modern Physics
William & Mary.description: Experiments in atomic, nuclear, solid state and elementary particle physics.

William & Mary.title: Electricity & Magnetism I
William & Mary.description: Development of the theory of electricity and magnetism including electrostatics, magnetostatics and Maxwellâ€™s equations.

William & Mary.title: Finite Automata
William & Mary.description: Theory of sequential machines, finite automata, Turing machines, recursive functions, computability of functions.

William & Mary.title: GenAI for Software Development
William & Mary.description: Building generative AI and deep learning to enhance and automate modern software development.

William & Mary.title: Ordinary Differential Equations
William & Mary.description: Solving differential equations using numerical methods, bifurcations, and qualitative analysis.

William & Mary.title: Thermodynamics & Statistical Mechanics
William & Mary.description: Quantum and thermal statistical mechanics applied to gases, solids, and radiation.

William & Mary.title: Data Structures
William & Mary.description: Stack, queue, linked list, tree, graph structures.

William & Mary.title: Discrete Structures
William & Mary.description: Sets, functions, boolean algebra, first order predicate calculus, trees, graphs and discrete probability.

William & Mary.title: Software Engineering
William & Mary.description: Object-oriented class implementation, abstraction techniques, defensive programming, and testing.

William & Mary.title: Algorithms
William & Mary.description: Algorithm design, complexity analysis, and NP-complete problems such as sorting and hashing.

William & Mary.title: Computer Organization
William & Mary.description: Assembly instructions, binary formatting, and hardware layouts.

William & Mary.title: Programming Languages
William & Mary.description: Programming paradigms and syntax for memory management, parameter passing, and event handling

William & Mary.title: Fundamentals of AI/ML
William & Mary.description: Core artificial intelligence and machine learning algorithms and their use cases.

William & Mary.title: Quantum Computing
William & Mary.description: Qubit superposition, algorithms, and quantum protocols for computing and fault tolerance.

William & Mary.title: Data Driven Decision Making
William & Mary.description: Data analysis, visualization, and statistical inference in R.

William & Mary.title: Quantum Mechanics I
William & Mary.description: Non-relativistic solutions of the Schrodinger equation in one and three dimensions, symmetry, identical particles.

William & Mary.title: Quantum Mechanics II
William & Mary.description: Perturbation theory, approximate methods, and applications of quantum mechanics for atomic, solid state and nuclear physics.

Pre-Matriculation.title: Computational Problem Solving
Pre-Matriculation.description: Introductory Python: variables, control structures, functions, and classes.

Pre-Matriculation.title: General Physics I
Pre-Matriculation.description: Mechanics, kinematics, forces, energy, and momentum.

Pre-Matriculation.title: General Physics II
Pre-Matriculation.description: Electricity, magnetism, circuits, waves, and optics.

Pre-Matriculation.title: Calculus I
Pre-Matriculation.description: Limits, derivatives, integrals, and optimization applications.

Pre-Matriculation.title: Calculus II
Pre-Matriculation.description: Advanced integration techniques and infinite sequences and series.

Pre-Matriculation.title: Linear Algebra
Pre-Matriculation.description: Vector spaces, matrices, eigenvalues, and linear transformations.

Pre-Matriculation.title: Multivariable Calculus
Pre-Matriculation.description: Multi-parametered functions, partial derivatives, and vector calculus.
